maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-02-12T11:11-0500

did.unittitle: Title (i.e. Everything but the kitchen sink, unitttitle) |||

descriptivenote.p: Title (i.e. Everything but the kitchen sink, unitttitle) ||| , Date expression (any text here overrides begin and end dates, otherwise yyyy-yyyy)||| (DigitalObjectLabel|||)

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials label |||
separatedmaterial.p: Separated Materials note content 1st note in "Notes, etc" tab, umpteenth note added, but dragged to first note position in notes tab in AT. It appears that the note order in AT has some impact on the note order in the resulting EAD. It looks as if those notes that go outside the DID are exporting simply in the order in which they appear in AT. |||

odd.head: Kate's -- note -- about -- input |||
odd.p: All generic text I added is meant to indicate the type of input field in the AT. Text I added has three pipes at the end of it ||| unless it was impossible due to the type of data (numeric). Data from related tables (e.g. Repository name) does not have three pipes, nor does text generated from the style sheet. I did not use pipes in text from real-world examples.

accruals.head: Accruals note
accruals.p: Accruals content without label -- 2nd note input, 3rd note on "Notes, etc." tab : |||

appraisal.head: Appraisal note
appraisal.p: Appraisal note without a label content |||

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p:
Bibliography note no "title" content ||| 5th note input . Can be wrapped in tags thus (but why not bibref?): content in blockquote|||
content in corpname|||
content in date||| content in emph with bold italic selected ||| content in extref |||
content in famname||| content in function|||

bibliography.head: Bibliography note "Title" area (in other notes this box is labeled "label") |||
bibliography.p:
Note in bibliography. wrapped text in persname (i.e. author|||
wrapped text in title render italic
wrapped text in geogname
wrapped text in corpname (i.e. publisher)
wrapped text in date (i.e. pub date) 9th note input. |||

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arrangement note content. 7th note input, then dragged and dropped. No label. |||

bioghist.p: Biographical historical note without label content. Note inserted placement by clicking in list of notes. |||
